website_summaries.verdict: Versatile flashlight that offers 2 light output levels for high power light or to conserve battery power as needed.
pros: Creates very pleasing beam of LED light
Strong build quality that stands up to tough conditions
Small and lightweight, with top-end light quality
Costs a little more than some other flashlights, but you can count on its performance
cons: Click tail-cap design doesn't appeal to some

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE FAKE
customer_reviews.text: I called Surefire due to a broken end cap. they asked me if the body of light was shiny or flat black. Its shiny they advised these are fake. surefire is flat black. and the rear cap they sent me for replacement did not fit since it not to surefire spec and a fake.
customer_reviews.author: Mario Fajardo

customer_reviews.title: Light, tough, and very bright.
customer_reviews.text: You know the LED headlights on cars that blind you? This is the hand held equivalent. This really puts out a beam. While my use is probably not PC for you, it is mounted on a rifle to handle a coyote problem on my place where night time raids are common. They definitely see the light at the end of the tunnel, and it is an oncoming train.
customer_reviews.author: CALNNC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Light
customer_reviews.text: Wow! What an improvement over the original G2. Much brighter with 320 lumens. I like the tail switch with click on/off or press in for momentary light. Also "Mastiff Press On-off Tactical Remote Switch" Fits this light. Haven't verified run time yet but all the reviews i've read say its good. The old G2 had a turn switch so I replaced it with the G2X switch and it works perfectly. Great value for the price and it comes with batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Crowbar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light...but not for everyone
customer_reviews.text: i'll keep this short it's a Surefire, so it's quality....The reason i say it's not for everyone is because of the switch set up.. 1st light touch -- momentary on Low 2nd light touch --momentary on High 1 solid click --on Low 2 solid clicks --on High this is IMO a very particular set up..There is no I repeat NO 'manual momentary High"..as if you are trying to do your own 'strobe' effect...it will go Low - High - Low -High -Low - High...etc this click system works for me perfectly and my needs..Thank You Surefire
customer_reviews.author: William M. berger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to mount on my rifle and it's perfect for my needs. Single max output of 600 lumens(yes it's true, I checked Surefire's website), and I don't care for low output usage. It feels very rugged and works great. This sucker is bright as all get out, lights up a room with a clean white light, and you can press it for temporary lighting application or click it for permanent hold.
customer_reviews.author: John k

customer_reviews.title: Great Light at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Surefire products are always great and this is no exception. Powerful flashlight, durable, and holds up well. This is my third one of these and in the future all the people that I care about that need bright, sturdy, flashlights will get one of these. Many may think that the price is a little bit high for a flashlight, but if your life or safety depends on your ability to have a bright light, it is worth a little extra money. Some flashlights cost hundreds of dollars, this is a very reasonable compromise of great quality and reasonable price for a superior product in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: R Haws

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Counterfeit. It broke after being on my nightstand for a year. I contacted surefire and sent them pictures and they verified it was a fake flashlight. Bottom line, don't order anything you care about on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go to EDC for the past decade
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I've been using these lights for the past 10 years or so. They work great, very bright (on high setting), compact and lightweight, durable. The single setting model works great as a gun light . The batteries last for months sometimes years depending on your level of use. I would typically change batteries every 6 months when I worked security. Have dropped these many times and they continued to work. The only issue these have is that the button stops working eventually and is not replaceable, this is my only gripe with this light but for the money there's not much that can beat it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: The low setting is perfect for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t use a flashlight much before getting this but now I use it all the time. The low setting is perfect for everyday use. When your eyes are adjusted for darkness it is plenty to fill the entire room with light, so much so I point it away from what I’m looking at to not blind myself. The high setting will light up stuff at 150 yards no problem. I’ve got this same light in the aluminum version too, but got this as a car light for winter. If you’re on the fence at all just get this light. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Snowden

customer_reviews.title: Five Star Flashlight - even 3 years later
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this review 3 years after purchasing my first G2X. I've worked on and off as a delivery driver since 2014, this flashlight was with me every night, and has been used daily, sometimes for close to an hour at a time. It gets hot with lengthy use, but thats not unexpected. The beam is focused, very bright, and goes a good distance. I have since bought 3 other G2X lights, and numerous other Surefire products. Surefire have great customer service, and stand behind their products. The batteries are the worst part, they are pricey, and can be burned up fairly quickly, but this light is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Not 600 LUMENS
customer_reviews.text: If I could, I would give it a 0 star rating. It isn't 600 lumens. It's 320!! I don't know if Surefire or Amazon did the mistake but they are lying to us. Don't get it.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: Bright, sturdy, reliable, long lasting, we love the brand!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone in my family has a SureFire. We got this one for my dad for Christmas and he loves it, never leaves home without it! The low level is great for seeing in your general area and the bright allows us to scan the edge of the yard and woods about 300 ft away - exactly what we needed. I use my bright 2-3 times per day and a set of batteries usually last me 4-7 months, longer for my husband. Not to mention this little flashlight could be used as a self defense tool if needed - very sturdy construction while feeling perfectly balanced in your hand! I've had mine 5 years and it's still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: photogipsy

customer_reviews.title: Not an authentic Surefire
customer_reviews.text: The tailcap began to crack and broke apart. I reached out to Surefire and sent them pictures. I was informed it was not an authentic Surefire light.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett Smith

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted 2 1/2 years and will go longer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this light for 2 1/2 years now and I can say it is an absolute beast. Starting with the construction, this thing can easily survive being ran over by a truck probably even more. The metal is extremely strong and the polymer seems unbreakable. But of course the light is the most important part, well that is extremely tough as well. The brightness is very good with a full battery, reaching out to 100 yards or further in the dark. Though there are no power settings which is a con, so when the battery starts to die the light gets pretty dim. Overall this is an amazing flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this surefire 2 years ago , I kept it in my truck for emergencies I went to use it and noticed the batteries where dead ! I tried to unscrew the tail cap but it just rotated , I contacted surefire and within 30 seconds the customer service rep told me I’ve been sold a counterfeit , the body was glossy the rotation on the tail cap and the bulb are the giveaway. I talked to 4 different people at amazon they all said tough luck because I bought it so long ago, if you are LE , a fireman, buy directly from surefire !
customer_reviews.author: Jeff carnes

customer_reviews.title: Professional Torch
customer_reviews.text: Best flashlight I ever ever owned. Incredibly bright. Functional, durable housing material. Thankfully only a single output mode (I have used others with multiple settings, and I rarely if ever use more than one). My only concern is that the batteries are not rechargeable and can become a fairly costly maintenance item. Surefire does offer a rechargeable battery (and charger) separately, which may need to be my next investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product that doesnt work every time
customer_reviews.text: Opened the new package, pressed the button ot test the light....and nothing. Oh so it doesnt come with new batteries right? Or they put a piece of non conductor so not to waste the battery life...or so I thought. I opened it up and there were two SureFire batteries inside. I tried pressing it again. Nothing. Tried a couple dozen of times, and I got a flicker. The. Another one. But they arent bright. Then all of a sudden, its very bright. But the buttons are inconsistent. The lighting is as well. Poor product or damaged one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Chiem

customer_reviews.title: Good light, keep extra batteries on you.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a patrol Officer and SWAT team member. I have used this light for two weeks now with a Thyrm Switchback. Pros: Size is perfect Low power setting is great for when you don’t need such a bright light and want to help preserve your night vision. It is even soft enough to shine at a subjects face to examine pupils or nystagmus during Field Sobriety Tests. High setting has enough power for confident vieweing on car stops or other work. Cons: It eats batteries fast.
customer_reviews.author: Boudreaux

customer_reviews.title: So no cycling through 4-5 flashlight modes like "Moonlight, low
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple torch, nothing complicated about it. Is amazingly bright, has 1 mode for output (Turbo Mode). So no cycling through 4-5 flashlight modes like "Moonlight, low, med, high, turbo, ultra, retina burning, will still blind you with your eye's closed" brightness modes. It just works. The button on the tail cap is clicky, and solid. I've dropped it a couple times on tile already, and has no damage, and still works. I'm looking at possibly buying a 2nd one. If only they made it with AA or AAA batteries. O'well. . . .
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Flashlight (and I have a lot of them)
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight was worth every penny. Two light settings, both of them very functional. Well made. Small, lightweight, and not clunky like many larger flashlights that aren't even as bright. This is my go to when I need a flashlight. I live on two acres out of town and I often need a flashlight when the power goes out or I need to go outside after dark. Keep spare batteries handy or buy rechargeables. It's power isn't free.
customer_reviews.author: Joy B.

customer_reviews.title: Update 1 year later: God light and works with Safariland 306 open top mini holder
customer_reviews.text: Received the G2X tactical and it’s as described- 600 lumens and will be perfect for a backup flashlight on the night shift. NOTE: If you are looking for a holder for this light, I recommend the Safariland 306 open top holder. UPDATE 1 year later: This light is solid, but it eats up batteries even not when in use. Working the grave shift, I go through about 2 batteries a month. When not in use, I unscrew the cap until there isn’t any contact.
customer_reviews.author: Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Definitely the 600 lumen model!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my dad, he absolutely loved it. ...as did I, so much so that I may have to pick up one as well. It's bright on 600 and has been used on both brightness' since he's received it. I'm sure it will last as long as his 320 lumen one and props to SureFire for making a solid light.
customer_reviews.author: Shrubf4

customer_reviews.title: Nice durable, bright light.  Nom Noms batteries
customer_reviews.text: Light is incredibly bright. I use it for inspections at work, and I have no issues seeing small details in dimly lit areas. I've dropped it from 20 feet to find it in good shape, and I've gotten it wet with oil and water and had no problems. Make sure you make a sizable investment in the 123 batteries, because it eats them breakfast. The light does turn into a light shade of yellow as the batteries degrade.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Handy size, good light output
customer_reviews.text: Nothing here to dislike. Have had a couple Surefires over the last 30 years. They have served in emergencies and as 'carry light' in case of blackout when I'm travelling. Batteries have a long shelf life (I buy the Surefire brand), so always ready. The Surefire lights have withstood recoil on a 12 gauge shotgun I use for varmints....you can't go wrong, I think.
customer_reviews.author: cogbern

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible(at least the older version are)
customer_reviews.text: I am a flashlight freak. I have dozens of all types from many manufactures. SureFire has become my favorite, my "go to" brand. Streamlight is second. This product is my seventh like it. I use them in my vehicles, my motorhome, my boat and on my AR platform rifles. I have NEVER had a problem. The only thing I have concerns about is the newer lights are some sort of plastic. My older versions are aluminum. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: S4 Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this light except for the way the two levels of brightness are activated. One push activates low power, and two pushes activates high power. There is no way to set it to always activate high power other than a double push. It’s not the end of the world, and it’s great for camping or power outages. I would choose a different model for professional use.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Gottsch

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought about 5 flashlights in the past 10 years. This one is extremely high quality. It's lightweight and just the right size for my right hand. It's brightness is quite good and the beam clearly illuminates objects more than 75 feet away in total darkness. I've used it rarely for many months and the batteries are still fine. I did purchase the Thyrm Switchback Flashlight Holder as well. It fits perfectly and is very comfortable in either hand.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: Love this light
customer_reviews.text: Great light for the price. I bought the single output version. I have many other multiple output lights and only ever use the full power setting. Fits well in the hand and the 300 lumens is all I need for work and play. Highly recommend this light.
customer_reviews.author: fuzzbuster

customer_reviews.title: *I bought two, G2X tactical flashlights, one for ...
customer_reviews.text: *I bought two, G2X tactical flashlights, one for mounting to a home defense shotgun, and one for an AR-15. They are very bright and cast a wide, even beam. The tail cap button is a simple click on/click off, and a half push turns the light on momentarily. Twisting the tail cap disables the light and the on/off button to prevent the light from accidentally being turned on. *I mounted these lights with Elzetta mounts(ZSM and ZFH1500). They fit perfectly. *Lights included batteries.
customer_reviews.author: bbaker

customer_reviews.title: The color is great for hunting
customer_reviews.text: There are lights just as bright in the <$30 range, but Surefire has never failed me and this light is very strong and battery efficient compared to my older models. The color is great for hunting, not too white like other LEDs that make colors on animal coats unintelligible. Small size to fit in your pocket, and has helped me shoot many creatures sacking my chicken coop, illuminating them very nicely to see through the scope on a dark night, up to at least 100 yards.
customer_reviews.author: George P. Hranowskyj

customer_reviews.title: SAWEEET!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome flashlight. I've been looking for one that has good brightness and well built but most importantly for me was the one setting brightness. I was sick of getting lights that had 3 settings on them as it would slow my work that I was doing because I had to worry about which setting I had on my flashlight in order to see right. This was the perfect match and to me a reasonable price. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: But after getting a few of these lights they have become my favorite way to illuminate something
customer_reviews.text: I used to always stay away from SureFire lights because I felt they were too bulky for how bright they were. I stuck to ultra bright but small lights. But after getting a few of these lights they have become my favorite way to illuminate something. The size makes it comfortable to carry for a long period of time, and the brighter colors are also very useful for when you need to find it quickly. For the money these are great lights that will last you for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Alvarenga

customer_reviews.title: Same great G2X but no case in packaging.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third G2X and they all are great. This one however came in a blister pack which did not include belt/carry case as every other light I ever purchased. I feel disappointed that weather surefire or the vendor decided to cheep out on such a insignificant yet very useful item just to make extra profit. Wonder what else they are skipping on to increase their profit margin. Don't think I'll be buying anymore for that simple reason.
customer_reviews.author: Zagger

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight. Color not represented correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to operate. The two selection intensity is easy to operate. First press high, press off then on again goes to low. Works on momentary mode too. The color however is not represented correctly on this. The back is a a different shade of yellow and the flashlight is no where close to the vibrant color shown on here. I bought the yellow to keep in my EDC bag of my car for easily identifying at night. Better than black but not as standout as I’d like.
customer_reviews.author: D Hill

customer_reviews.title: yellow is nice
customer_reviews.text: really like the color were outside a lot ! and if ya need both hand n happen to set your light down for a moment n walk away , its really easy to find with its bright color .. plus its a surefire brand which is really bright , this brand has been a great brand to and product the sell ..
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight hands down
customer_reviews.text: If you know anything about flashlights surefire makes the best. I've had cheappies, better than cheapies and many others. I always fall back to surefire. I'm still upset I lost my other surefire with a beveled edge three years ago. This model is cool because it has two light modes. One click is sufficient for most purposes but when I need more light I just give it two quick clicks. This helps to save battery life I know because I haven't had to buy new batteries yet. My old surefire only had one super bright mode and ate up batteries like cookie monster at a the keebler factory.
customer_reviews.author: dean prentice

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse- multi use light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this light in 2014 and just changed the batteries for the second time (with pretty regular use) so I figured I'd finally review it. The light itself is almost perfect, I just wish it had programmable settings and strobe. It's a great multiuse light and I've bought a rail mount, a pressure pad tail cap, a kydex holster, and a red lens to use it as a detachable WML
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Qualirt, dependable light
customer_reviews.text: This light has a decent output and is very rugged. I used this as my backup light for awhile and it had been out through the ringer. Multiple drops, knocked into things in my pocket, all types of on climate weather and not once did it fail to perform. I have since put this on an AR with a standard light clamp and it still functions flawlessly after hundreds of rounds through that AR.
customer_reviews.author: Nate S.

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong - Buy more than 1 - You will buy more
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with Surefire hand held flashlights. I have one stashed everywhere - bedroom, car, living room, inside gun safe, on every rifle, and even considering putting one in every bathroom. Stash this in places you need light with a couple of extra Surefire batteries (10 year shelf life) in a zip lock bag/case and you will not regret spending the money, not one cent when the time comes to use it. I've used it for everything from emergency (power outage/extreme storms/blizzards), camping, car trouble in the middle of nowhere, dark environment shooting courses, and even when fixing a bathroom sink; the size and power combination makes the purpose of this flashlight virtually limitless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Is the One You Want
customer_reviews.text: I currently own three of these flashlights - for my car, home, and mobile toolbox. It's a great product that puts out an amazing amount of light (in fact, the low setting is sufficient for many tasks). It's built like a tank, yet is lightweight to carry. As it uses primary lithium cells instead of alkaline, worries about leaking batteries are eliminated and shelf life is significantly enhanced.
customer_reviews.author: Don_CC12

customer_reviews.title: Lightening strike
customer_reviews.text: Powerhouse torch. When Surefire states 320 lumens - that roughly equal to the (top) Asian manufacturers stating 1,200 lumen. When my wife first pressed the flashlight's button (and 15 lumen came out) she was in the kitchen and she said "Wow, that's a pretty strong light." Then she pressed it off and on again and BOOM! 320 lumens bounced off the light colored kitchen walls like a lightening strike!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Munger

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA. Military issue. Enough said.
customer_reviews.text: High quality flashlight. Build quality is noticeable when you hold it. Non-metallic coating prevents damage to other tools and equipment. Dual mode (dim/bright) is fantastic. Button is smooth and operates perfectly. Easy to disengage for storage and to prevent accidental on.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Guess i got boned :(
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light for a readable price. The reason I gave it 2 stars is because it came with an open package and dead batterys. I tried to contact the seller but received no help. Looks like someone brought it then retuned it. After buying the unstandard size battery's it worked great. Was probably just bad luck.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: The flashlight is good and bright and the position in the mount is ...
customer_reviews.text: Mounted this light on my Remington 870 Police Magnum with a Modkin LED Tactical Flashlight Mount Quick Release Picatinnly Rail Mount (sold on Amazon) on a GG&G 1390 Forearm flashlight mount (purchased elsewhere). The result was just what I was looking for. The flashlight is good and bright and the position in the mount is perfect and illuminates the front sight as well.
customer_reviews.author: shoddymill

customer_reviews.title: I have a bright future with this light
customer_reviews.text: This is my third surefire and I love how affordable this one is. The one I got appears to be a strong and very white light (not the greenish tint others have posted about). It's funny that I feel like this has less lumins than a Fenix (sp) I have but seems stronger. I got this specifically for a custom kydex flashlight, magazine, handcuff holder for low profile plainclothes work and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: NoChicagono

customer_reviews.title: A great flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second or third one now. I really like these flashlights. They are reliable, simple, and well made. I am fond of the older models because it is just enough light without blinding me while trying to use it. Will buy again and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my dad heckled me, saying my Maglight wasn't as bright as his SureFire. I love this flashflight. My dad accidently turned it on in his face and momentarily blinded himself. LOL. So not only can this flashlight be used for light, but it can also be used for self defense...blind an attacker.
customer_reviews.author: A Lopez

customer_reviews.title: 100% 👌👌
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderfully made product!! Very durable it seems. Good weight and balance. VERY VERY bright. I would hate to be an intruder/stranger. This thing is blinding!! It's amazing how bright it is. Can't wait to take this to the range and get a feel for it with my weapon as an EDC item!! Once again GREAT product!! 👌👌
customer_reviews.author: JerBear

customer_reviews.title: Not up to Surefire's usual standards
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of SureFire G2 Nitrolon flashlights that I like, so I decided to try one of these "CombatLight" flashlights. The extra ring around the body of the light is supposed to facilitate a "tactical" hold ("tactical" is a word used FAR too much these days) but after trying it, I remain skeptical.. As to the light itself it appears to be durable and the illumination pattern is typically Surefire bright, but on my particular example the button requires about 2 or 3 times the pressure to actuate that my SureFire G2 Nitrolons require - in my opinion, too much for convenience. For this reason I have to ding the rating 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: JohnInTX

customer_reviews.title: ... for a cheaper surefire light that people are having great success with this mounted on rifles and even shotguns
customer_reviews.text: i normally buy cheap little flashlight but i needed a light for an AR 15 and looked at some reviews and found that for a cheaper surefire light that people are having great success with this mounted on rifles and even shotguns. this is a tactical light and is not rated for firearms but it is working good for a lot of people. and i love this light, very nice throw with just enough spill to the sides to let you see to the sides of you but with most of the beam concentrated to the center. i will be buying more in the near future and with the surefire name you know the quality is there.
customer_reviews.author: lone gunman

customer_reviews.title: Great for a weapon light
customer_reviews.text: Great for a weapon light, just throw it in a 1 inch mount for your rail, M-Lok, Keymod, etc and start rocking. Plenty bright for nighttime room clearing, out in the woods, etc. Honestly if you start going brighter than this, you will tend to wash out your vision, which could be bad, so this light strikes a great balance.
customer_reviews.author: LordInglip

customer_reviews.title: Combat light
customer_reviews.text: Good single output light, simple operation. Works well for one hand operation while using another tool in the other hand...as described it is a “combat light” so it’s not ideal for walking the dog or a power outage. Single purpose of on and off while searching a house etc.
customer_reviews.author: PStrac

customer_reviews.title: The best flashlight company out there
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best flashlight for the money. Simple to operate and nothing complicated about it. They are known to taker a beating and continue to work flawlessly. I have a ton of high end flashlights and this one is the best value for the money. The poly body is nice in the cold vs a metal one that would make your hands freezing. I wish they had a "cookie cutter bezzel" on the front for personal defense but at this price I can't complain. GREAT flashlight. Super bright.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great light for cheap
customer_reviews.text: I mounted mine on a Mossberg 930, even though it is not rated for weapons light. Still works under a lot of recoil from 12 gauge ammo. Do not hesitate to grab one, or two.
customer_reviews.author: Mozzberg

customer_reviews.title: illuminating review on light with dim prospects
customer_reviews.text: I have mostly Streamlight illumination tools; most of which are a great mix of quality and value. However, I needed a better nightstand light with low output for non-emergencies and high output for potential emergencies. The G2X is easy to operate, has great button feel, and has become my go-to light for most things--not just investigating what the dog is barking at in the back yard. Wish it came with a belt clip. But the dim setting is perfect for getting around the house without alarming anyone else--and it is nice having the option to quickly crank it up when needed.
customer_reviews.author: W. Overton

customer_reviews.title: Great Light
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan boy of Surefire for more than 20 years. This light is very easy to use, light weight and bright. It's also one of the least expensive lights you can buy from Surefire.
customer_reviews.author: AW3

customer_reviews.title: It works. Good.
customer_reviews.text: It works every time, but for the price it better. Press the button once and get "hmph...that's handy" amount of useful light. Press twice and get "holy cow that's bright" amount of useful light. I bought on sale in 2017 and am just now about to replace the 1st set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Logdog

customer_reviews.title: Super great quality! My wife loves this flashlight and carries it in her purse all the time!
customer_reviews.text: Super great quality! My wife loves this flashlight and carries it in her purse all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R Adams

customer_reviews.title: Super bright. Two drastically different settings
customer_reviews.text: Can't praise Amazon enough. First one didn't show up. They sent me another overnight. Super bright. Two drastically different settings. One issue though. When left in the "off" position for more than a few seconds, the first click gives you the low power beam....I bought this as a light source to be carried with my HD pistol next to the bed. When I wake up in the dark of night, I want the bright light first, not the dull, gentle light. Otherwise, it's perfect
customer_reviews.author: Nofunofanykind

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tactical security and maintain a two-handed grip.
customer_reviews.text: Even I n the middle of the day this thing is like looking into the sun...! The amount of light this puts out and the tightness of the beam is amazing..! There is absolutely no hole in the center of the spot produced. It's like what you see in the movies, only it's real. It's very easy to hold in my non-trigger hand in a two-handed grip, and still be able to flash the light on with a minimal squeeze. I'm extremely happy with this purchase, and Amazon sells it for under half the price of what the exact same part number is going for at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful light
customer_reviews.text: I have this light in the "pro" edition and I love it. The body is tough, solid, and does not rattle. The weight and feel is wonderful, and I definitely can inflict damage with the crenulated bezel. The on button is very responsive and good for quickly illuminating an area, yet resistant enough to not accidentally turn on while in your pocket. Overall, a great light that I can find no cons for.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels well made. Simple use with only low or high power and don't have to cycle through 3-5 options some lights have. Starts on low but if push tail cap button again within 2 seconds its high power. Low power is actually bright enough for indoors at night; too bright can actually be detrimental. I like the fact you can twist the end cap if you want so it won't turn on accidentally, like if button pushed, if you are carrying it in a pants or carfo pocket, or keep it "ready to go" on the night stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light. Although they now come with clicky (for ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome light. Although they now come with clicky (for constant on) tail caps. You can still rotate the tail cap to deactivate BUT... I wanted momentary only, so I called SureFire and they sent me a momentary only tail cap for free. Awesome light!!!!! Especially with the upgraded 320 lumens. I was using a Streamlight ProTac UP (750 lumen) but was just too bright for indoors. 320 is perfect with the momentary only tail cap.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina P.

customer_reviews.title: Very Bright.  battery life is actually not bad but this is my nightstand light so not a lot of use
customer_reviews.text: It is a surefire. It is bright as hell and works great. I have had it for several months and still on original battery. I don't use it everyday because of it's size. I have a smaller, rechargeable streamlight as my EDC. It sits on my nightstand for emergencies or when the remotes disappear. It is a great flashlight though. Thinking about mounting it to my rifle but it's technically not rated for that.
customer_reviews.author: justin adams

customer_reviews.title: Quality is outstanding
customer_reviews.text: So this advertised as 320 Lumens in this page but on the packaging it states 600 lumens? No complaints here just wondering if anyone knows what's up with that. Anyways the light is very sturdy and well built, and it is very bright. Nice even spill with a bright center. Bought another to keep specifically in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: No nonsense, always works flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Great no nonsense always works flashlight. The 320 lumens provides a big blast of light wherever you point it. No fumbling with this light ever. Push the button in the back for on. Let go for off. Twist the end cap for continuous light.
customer_reviews.author: defbear

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use under stress.
customer_reviews.text: Great for concealed carry. Big enough to use in high stress situations , I think. I may replace the tail cap switch to a simple click on and off type if I can't get used to this one with the momentary push on - off and rotate to stay on. The ring in the middle is perfect for the cigar hold in the off hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: First class light!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a competitor's light that advertised 3 times the lumen output. I went ahead and took a chance, and spent the extra money on the SureFire. It is BRIGHTER than the other light! It only costs a little more to go first class, boys.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey boy

customer_reviews.title: Great tactical flash light
customer_reviews.text: Great tactical flash light. Very durable and light weight. The syringe grip makes it more versatile than others in its class. Fits perfectly in your pocket or in a pouch on your gear with out getting in the way. I like the fact that I can use it in conjunction with the FM35 Surefire red filter. This option allows me to carry one light for a wide range of applications.
customer_reviews.author: PerspectiveG21

customer_reviews.title: Great, low cost surefire
customer_reviews.text: I love this light for a number of reasons The dual outputs are so well thought out. The low isn't too bright and the high projects well but doesn't blind the user either. I prefer surefires UI for changing between settings. Click once for low output. Release and click again within 2 seconds to go to high mode. It's a much more reliable way to get to the high output than on my lights from other manufacturers. If you need high mode quickly, I like knowing that it will come on with only one more click
customer_reviews.author: BatmanShampoo

customer_reviews.title: Fit n finish is great. Quite bright n matches the specs for lumen ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. Superb quality. Fit n finish is great. Quite bright n matches the specs for lumen output subjectively. Great balance between a focused central beam and a wide field of view. I use mine on two AR-15 rifles for lighting in Elzetta carbine front sight mounts (a great buy BTW). I highly recommend this flashlight. Hi quality and performs as advertised. A great value! Great quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Keko

customer_reviews.title: bright and durable
customer_reviews.text: My husband and daughter have rod cone dystrophy so night time vision is extremely slim for them. We have purchased several of these G2X for having in purses and backpacks for easy to grab use for them. The flashlights are great, have held up wonderfully being thrown in all sorts of bags. Always ready when we need them, bright and helpful. I like them for at night when I hear noises way out at the barn, all other flashlights spread and disappear long before reaching the barn, these find the critter making the racket and help me run it off without leaving the deck.
customer_reviews.author: lifemom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my fiance, so here is his review about the flashlight: I work in law enforcement so a good flashlight is something you need especially if you work the night shift. This is a very powerful light. It lights up areas about 50-60 yards away no problem. It burns right through tinted windows. Small and compact but dont let the size fool you.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly what I thought I was getting
customer_reviews.text: This is a very small (5-6 inch) flashlight. It seems to provide decent light but the batteries are very small and an unusual size which will make it difficult to replace them. Based upon the description, this is not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa I.

customer_reviews.title: Gross misrepresentation
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are so disappointed in this very expensive flashlight. The lumens are not as advertised. It's the sorriest flashlight we've ever used as far as trying to see outside in the dark. Even the cheapest flashlight we've ever bought was better than this. SAVE YOUR $$$.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hinkley

customer_reviews.title: G2X
customer_reviews.text: HAVE THE SUREFIRE G2X MOUNTED ON ALL MY AR's QUALITY ALL THE WAY, GREAT TACTICAL LIGHT GLADE I DID!
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH O BARARD

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is just incredible! It is the brightest flashlight I have ever seen, by far. I compared it to my massive 4-cell Maglight, and this light is MUCH brighter and has better focus. It is also incredibly light, and the plastic feels strong and durable. I would buy this again in a heartbeat. But I might get the "pro" version, as the light is SO bright it's actually blinding. A lower output mode would be useful.
customer_reviews.author: P. R. B.

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS LIGHT
customer_reviews.text: This is a superb light for the money. I would totally mount this light on my defence carbine. Totally dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Tacrancher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product that works well and fits my needs
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product that works well and fits my needs. I especially love the design and having the ability to hold the device in different ways based upon my comfort as well as my needs. It's very bright and the simple operation is greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: STL

customer_reviews.title: Budget Friendly Alternative
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an alternate budget friendly AR weapon light. I am extremely satisfied with this. Paired it with a light Mlok flashlight mount. All of this for under $70!
customer_reviews.author: Gunzalez.556

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashlight!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight!!!! My Son picked this out and he loves it, just the perfect size!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight! Love the dual settings
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight! Love the dual settings. Very bright and beam reaches a long way. Well constructed and a powerful light in a small package. Great for night hunts or early dawn getting to hunting blinds.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Ybarbo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Gets too hot
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight gets super hot, I've burned myself before because it turned on in my pocket. The button you push to turn the light on is sensitive, I'll hold the button down and just slightly take pressure off and the light goes off. Probably alot better lights out there. I dislike this one for work since it gets so darn hot! Burning hot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: I now have two of these flashlights. They aren't cheap but they will outlast less expensive lights so they are actually a better value. When a Ford Raptor drive over my first one but didn't damage it I ordered the second one. I really like the on/off button at the end of the handle.
customer_reviews.author: JDRanger

customer_reviews.title: but one of the best for the price in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This is not the fanciest tactical light around, but one of the best for the price in my opinion. Used a similar model (black) if not the same one in Iraq 2006, and several training exercises leading up to deployment. Sufficient brightness for room clearing, or blinding a target for a critical split second. Currently keep this light in my vehicle for quick access. Worked well for me using a broom stick without a pressure switch. Batteries can get expensive; I would not recommend using the G2X for camping, or a long duration of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight, but it uses the "camera batteries"
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight, but it uses the "camera batteries". If I had known this when I purchased, I probably would have purchased a different product. It's probably my fault for not fully reading the description
customer_reviews.author: Bill_in_Louisiana

customer_reviews.title: Best light I own. Buying nothing but these from now on (I have 2)
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flashlight. In a tactical situation I wanted a light that comes on super bright and I don’t have to toggle through low/high/strobe. At 600 lumens it’s amazingly bright and the on/of tail button is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around compact flashlight, love it for weapon mount use
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight with impressive lumen output. I mounted mine to my Colt LE6920 and it works exactly as expected. Different lighting modes is also very nice to have. To me it is ideal as a weapon mount light but I’ve used it as a stand-alone flashlight just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't look into the light.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice item. Obviously durable. I didn't really know what "600 lumens" meant, other than bright. Holy cats!! Aimed, at the ceiling, in the dark, it lights the whole room. Aimed down the street, at night, most objects, two blocks away, are readily identifiable. Looking into it, when energized, would be quite silly. Even I know better. Might do some damage.
customer_reviews.author: still hiding

customer_reviews.title: One star deducted because I was unable to activate with the heel of my palm while holding a handgun (one of the recommended techniques for integrating pistol with light)
customer_reviews.text: Simple and straightforward which is important in a high stress, quick response, situation. One star deducted because I was unable to activate with the heel of my palm while holding a handgun (one of the recommended techniques for integrating pistol with light).
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this light it is very bright and I love the tail cap it is easy to press on even with my fire gloves and fits well in pockets and on my helmet. I'm very happy with the light and will try and buy more
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great light for a pro
customer_reviews.text: Battery last for ever. It defaults to low light setting on first click. A little irritating at first but after a while you get used to double clicking if high beam is needed. This set up save battery life dramatically. High beam is crazy bright.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Landgarten

customer_reviews.title: Bright and Reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I like to have a few flashlights handy around the house. I thought I could use cheaper brands for the less critical locations. No. Endless frustrations with other cheaper brands.
customer_reviews.author: RIMc

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Flashlight - a lifetime keeper...................
customer_reviews.text: This is one impressive flashlight. Very compact (which is what I wanted) and durable (which I wanted) and also bright as stated on the product (which I wanted). Easy on/off function as well as using the lower brightness mode is still bright enough for nights outdoor. Arrived on date committed and is exactly what I wanted when ordering. My 1st SureFire but certainly not my last.
customer_reviews.author: G. B.

customer_reviews.title: Surefire G2X - my Go-To light for EDC and more!
customer_reviews.text: With the Surefire G2X, the "G2" must stand for "Go-To"! This tough, lightweight torch is fantastic for an EDC bag and PERFECT for a home protection firearm. If you've got a shotgun or a tactical rifle or carbine, this light is exceptional for putting a blinding light onto whatever goes bump in the night. As Colonel Jeff Cooper taught us, the 4th rule of gun safety is to be sure of your target (and what's behind it). With 200 lumens of blistering white light, you'll be much more confident whether you're walking back to your car in a dark parking area or checking out a noise around your home.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Add to cart, proceed to checkout
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Everything. It's a great item. Rugged, reliable, easy to use, lightweight, low power consumption (in low power mode), very bright (in high power mode). Cons: Not rechargeable... if that's what you need. But I didn't. Bottom line: Need a small, lightweight, rugged flashlight? Don't need it to be rechargeable? This is it.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Basic Light for what ever you need.
customer_reviews.text: Simple basic weapon light or hands on light. Decent lumens on high and low.No strobe function which is the only con. I still prefer the streamlight polytac because it has the strobe function. Over all a simple light that will take a beating. It's a surefire
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic battery compartment cap will NOT last!
customer_reviews.text: Battery cap is a cheap piece of plastic that cracked and no longer holds the batteries correctly inside the flashlight to make contact. Piece of Chinese crap. Complete waste of money. Sticking with Streamlight going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Mackler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light
customer_reviews.text: Best flashlight ever! Quick shipping, great price , and unbeatable Surefire quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High quality, super bright light
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. This light is installed in a Safari Land picatinny rail mount. This allows for thumb activation of a super bright light.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

product_meta.title: SureFire G2X Series LED Flashlights with Tough Nitrolon Body
product_meta.description:
Specially designed to meet the needs of law enforcement professionals, the SureFire G2X LE is a higher-output version of our best-selling G2X Pro that leads with high output on its first press or click. It features a high-performance LED that generates a max output of 400 lumens of blinding white light focused by a parabolic reflector into a versatile beam with significant reach and ample surround light for maintaining good situational awareness, crucial in law enforcement. At its lower output the G2X LE produces a useful 15-lumen beam that provides extended runtime on a set of batteries, for tasks that don’t require as much light. 

A click-style tactical tailcap switch controls the light’s output--simply press or click to unleash all 400 lumens in momentary- or constant-on mode, an important feature for law enforcement applications where instant access to maximum output provides a tactical advantage. Return to off and press or click again within two seconds for G2X LE’s lower-output 15-lumen beam.

Featuring a lightweight, durable Nitrolon polymer body designed for a secure hold, a Mil-Spec hard-anodized aluminum head, and O-rings and gasket seals to keep out moisture and dust, the G2X LE is as rugged as it is functional. It makes an ideal duty light for anyone who wears a badge-or a perfect everyday-carry light for anyone who demands a professional-grade flashlight that’ll take on just about any situation.
feature_bullets: Virtually indestructible LED emitter regulated to maximize light output and runtime
Two output levels - high of 600 lumens for maximum light, and low of 15 lumens for extended runtime
Dual-output tailcap click switch--press for momentary-on low, click for constant-on low, return to off then press or click again for high
Precision micro-textured reflector creates smooth, optimized beam
Tough Nitrolon body, anodized aluminum bezel

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
